get.summary: Allows you to retrieve, add and update payroll employees in a Xero organisation
Allows you to retrieve, add and update a Work Location in a Xero US organisation
Allows you to retrieve, add, update and delete Payroll Items in a Xero organisation
Allows you to retrieve, add and update pay runs in a Xero organisation
Allows you to retrieve and add Pay schedules in a Xero organisation
Allows you to retrieve and update paystubs in a Xero organisation
Allows you to retrieve the Payroll settings of a Xero organisation
Allows you to retrieve, add and update Payroll Timesheets in a Xero organisation

MiddleNames.description: Middle name(s) of the employee (max length = 35)

SocialSecurityNumber.description: Social Security Number of the employee (xxx-xx-xxxx)

TerminationDate.description: Termination date of employee (YYYY-MM-DD). Note this is only returned when retrieving an individual Employee with a Status of TERMINATED

PayScheduleID.description: Xero unique identifier – PayScheduleID for the employee

IsAuthorisedToApproveTimeOff.description: Boolean to specify if employee is authorised to approve time off

IsAuthorisedToApproveTimesheets.description: Boolean to specify if employee is authorised to approve timesheets

EmployeeID.description: Xero unique identifier for an Employee

StreetAddress.description: Street Address for employee home address

SuiteOrAptOrUnit.description: Suite, Apartment or Unit information for employee home address

State.description: State abbreviation for employee home address

Zip.description: Zip (Post code) for employee home address

Lattitude.description: The Latitude of employee home address

Longitude.description: The Longitude of employee home address

SalaryAndWagesID.description: Xero unique identifier for SalaryAndWage item. e.g c56b19ef-75bf-45e8-98a4-e699a96609f7

EarningsTypeID.description: Xero unique identifier for EarningsType item. e.g c56b19ef-75bf-45e8-98a4-e699a96609f7

HourlyRate.description: The Hourly rate of the Salary and Wages Type. Applies only when SalaryWagesType is HOURLY

AnnualSalary.description: The annual salary for the Salary and wages. Applies only when SalaryWagesType is SALARY

EffectiveDate.description: The effective date of the Salary and Wages

StreetAddress.description: Street address of the work location (max length = 400)

City.description: The city name of the address (max length = 50)

State.description: The state name of the address

WorkLocationID.description: Xero identifier for a work location

SuitOrAptOrUnit.description: Suite or apartment or unit information (max length = 50)

IsPrimary.description: Set to true to make this the primary work location

BankAccounts.description: The Bank accounts for the employee. Only Applies when PaymentMethodType is DIRECTDEPOSIT

AccountHolderName.description: The name of bank account holder exactly how the bank has it.

StatementText.description: The text that will appear on your employee’s bank statement when they receive payment

RoutingNumber.description: Bank routing number is the nine digit number used to identify a financial institution

AccountNumber.description: The account number for the bank account

Amount.description: Fixed amounts (for example, if an employee wants to have $100 of their salary transferred to one account, and the remaining amount to another)

Remainder.description: Set it to true if this bank account should be the Remainder bank account

TimeOffName.description: The name of the leave type

allOf.description: Identifier of the leave type (see PayItems)

NumberOfUnits.description: The balance of the leave available

TypeOfUnits.description: The type of units as specified by the LeaveType (see PayItems)

allOf.description: Name of the earnings type (max length = 100)

RateType.description: Only when EarningsCategory is OVERTIMEEARNINGS, ALLOWANCE, ADDITIONALEARNINGS

TypeOfUnits.description: Only when EarningsCategory is ADDITIONALEARNINGS, ALLOWANCE and RateType is RATEPERUNIT

Multiple.description: This is the multiplier used to calculate the rate per unit, based on the employee’s ordinary earnings type. For example, for time and a half enter 1.5. Only applicable if RateType is MULTIPLE

DoNotAccrueTimeOff.description: Set it to true if time off is NOT to be accumulated based on the hours reported to this earnings type

IsSupplemental.description: Set it to true if this earnings type qualifies as a supplemental earnings according to the IRS regulations, e.g bonus or commission

Amount.description: Optional for EarningsCategory COMMISSION, BONUS, CASHTIPS, NONCASHTIPS, RETROACTIVEPAY, CLERGYHOUSINGALLOWANCE, CLERGYHOUSINGINKIND (this will be the amount that will be added to the employee’s earnings on a per pay period basis). The ALLOWANCE & ADDITIONALEARNINGS EarningsCategory will also have the Amount field when the Rate Type is selected as FIXEDAMOUNT

allOf.description: Name of the benefit type (max length = 100)

BenefitCategory.description: The category defines the tax implications of the benefit type so it is taxed properly. See BenefitCategory

LiabilityAccountCode.description: The account to which the amount of the benefit is to be credited

ExpenseAccountCode.description: The account to which the amount of the benefit is to be debited.

StandardAmount.description: This is a default amount you can set for all employees assigned to this benefit type

CompanyMax.description: The company max is the maximum amount set as a default amount for that particular benefit type for all employees assigned this benefit type in a single year

Percentage.description: This is a default percentage you can set for all employees assigned to this benefit type

ShowBalanceOnPaystub.description: Set this to true if you want this benefit item amount and YTD balance will show on the employee’s paystubs

allOf.description: Name of the deduction type (max length = 50)

DeductionCategory.description: The category defines the tax implications of the deduction type so it is taxed properly

CalculationType.description: Deductions can be a fixed amount, or they can be calculated as a percentage of the employee’s total earnings. Standard Plan, Catch-up Plan. Only needed DeductionCategory is not AFTERTAXDEDUCTION, DEPENDEDNTCARE, FLEXIBLESPENDINGACCOUNT,HSASINGLEPLAN, HSAFAMILYPLAN, SECTION125PLAN

LiabilityAccountCode.description: The computed amount of the deduction is credited to this account. See See Accounts

StandardAmount.description:
This is a default amount you can set for all employees assigned to this deduction type. If you have more than one employee that pays the same amount for health insurance, setting this amount will save you time when setting up the employee deductions. If you choose not to set an amount here, you can enter the amounts to be deducted on a per employee basis. Only applicable when DeductionCategory is AFTERTAXDEDUCTION, DEPENDENTCARE, FLEXIBLESPENDINGACCOUNT,
SECTION125PLAN

CompanyMax.description:
The company max is the maximum amount set as a default amount to be deducted for that particular deduction type for all employees assigned this deduction type in a single year. For example, the IRS publishes limits for certain deduction types each year. You can set a company maximum that is lower than the IRS limit, depending on your plan requirements. If you don’t set a maximum, the deduction will stop automatically when the IRS limit is reached.
Only applicable when DeductionCategory is AFTERTAXDEDUCTION, DEPENDENTCARE, FLEXIBLESPENDINGACCOUNT,
SECTION125PLAN

allOf.description: Name of the reimbursement type (max length = 50)
Name of the time off type (max length = 50)

TimeOffCategory.description:
Select Unpaid Time Off to indicate that an employee will not get paid when taking this time off type.
If Paid Time Off is selected the employee will get paid when taking this time off type and you can accrue the liability on the Balance Sheet

ExpenseAccountCode.description: The account to which the amount of the time off is to be debited. Only applies for TimeOffCategory of PAIDTIMEOFF

LiabilityAccountCode.description: The computed amount of the time off is credited to this account

ShowBalanceToEmployee.description: Set it to true if you want the balance for this time off type to show on the employee’s paystub and in the employee’s My Payroll account.

PayScheduleID.description: Xero Identifier for the Pay Schedule

PayRunPeriodEndDate.description: Pay run period end date. Needed if it is an unscheduled pay run

PayRunPeriodStartDate.description: Period Start Date for the PayRun

UpdateDateUTC.description: The update date for the PayRun

PaymentDate.description: The Payment Date of the Pay Schedule

StartDate.description: The Start Date of the Pay Schedule

ScheduleType.description: The ScheduleType defines the frequency in which an employee gets paid

Earnings.description: The Total Earnings for the PayRun

Deductions.description: The Total Deductions for the PayRun

Tax.description: The Total Tax for the PayRun

Reimbursements.description: The Total Reimbursement for the PayRun

NetPay.description: The Total NetPay for the PayRun

EarningsTypeID.description: Xero identifier for payroll earnings type.

RatePerUnit.description: Rate per unit for earnings rate.

EarningsTypeID.description: Xero identifier for payroll earnings type.

RatePerUnit.description: Rate per unit for earnings rate.

EarningsTypeID.description: Xero identifier for payroll earnings type.

RatePerUnit.description: Rate per unit for earnings type

DeductionTypeID.description: Xero identifier for payroll earnings type.

Percentage.description: The Percentage of the Deduction Line.

ReimbursementTypeID.description: Xero identifier for payroll reimbursement type

ExpenseAccount.description: Reimbursement expense account. For posted pay run you should be able to see expense account code

BenefitTypeID.description: Xero identifier for payroll benefit type

TimeOffTypeID.description: Xero identifier for payroll time off type

Balance.description: Balance for the time off type

Accounts.description: Payroll Account details for Bank, WagesPayable and WagesExpense. See Accounts

TrackingCategories.description: Tracking categories for Employees and Timesheets. See Tracking Categories

TrackingCategoryID.description: Xero tracking category identifier. e.g c56b19ef-75bf-45e8-98a4-e699a96609f7

EmployeeID.description: The Xero identifier for an employee

TimesheetID.description: The Xero identifier for a Payroll Timesheet

EarningsTypeID.description: The Xero identifier for an Earnings Type

TrackingItemID.description: The Xero identifier for a Tracking Category <TrackingOptionID>. The <TrackingOptionID> must belong to the TrackingCategory selected as <TimesheetCategories> under Payroll Settings.

NumberOfUnits.description: Number of units of a Timesheet line

WorkLocationID.description: The Xero identifier for a Work Location, which must have been added for this employee under Payroll -> Employees -> Employment.
